 1594:                           if
 1595:                               is_integer(V), 0 =< V, V < Range ->
 1596:                                   St1
 1597:                           end
 1598:                   end
 1599:           end,
 1600:           {splitmix64,next}, Iterations,
 1601:           TMarkUniform64Bit, OverheadUniform64Bit),
 1602:     %%
 1603:     ByteSize = 16, % At about 100 bytes crypto_bytes breaks even to exsss
 1604:     ct:log("~nRNG ~w bytes performance~n",[ByteSize]),
 1605:     [TMarkBytes1,OverheadBytes1|_] =
 1606:         measure_1(
 1607:           fun (Mod, _State) ->
 1608:                   Generator = fun Mod:bytes_s/2,
 1609:                   fun (St0) ->
 1610:                           ?CHECK_BYTE_SIZE(
 1611:                              Generator(ByteSize, St0), ByteSize, Bin, St1)
 1612:                   end
 1613:           end,
 1614:           case crypto_support() of
 1615:               ok ->
 1616:                   Algs ++ [crypto_bytes, crypto_bytes_cached];
 1617:               _ ->
 1618:                   Algs
 1619:           end, Iterations),
 1620:     _ =
 1621:         measure_1(
 1622:           fun (_Mod, _State) ->
 1623:                   fun (St0) ->
 1624:                           ?CHECK_BYTE_SIZE(
 1625:                              mwc59_bytes(ByteSize, St0), ByteSize, Bin, St1)
 1626:                   end
 1627:           end, {mwc59,bytes}, Iterations,
 1628:           TMarkBytes1, OverheadBytes1),
 1629:     %%
 1630:     ByteSize2 = 1000, % At about 100 bytes crypto_bytes breaks even to exsss
 1631:     ct:log("~nRNG ~w bytes performance~n",[ByteSize2]),
 1632:     [TMarkBytes2,OverheadBytes2|_] =
 1633:         measure_1(
 1634:           fun (Mod, _State) ->
 1635:                   Generator = fun Mod:bytes_s/2,
 1636:                   fun (St0) ->
 1637:                           ?CHECK_BYTE_SIZE(
 1638:                              Generator(ByteSize2, St0), ByteSize2, Bin, St1)
 1639:                   end
 1640:           end,
 1641:           case crypto_support() of
 1642:               ok ->
 1643:                   Algs ++ [crypto_bytes, crypto_bytes_cached];
 1644:               _ ->
 1645:                   Algs
 1646:           end, Iterations div 50),
 1647:     _ =
 1648:         measure_1(
 1649:           fun (_Mod, _State) ->
 1650:                   fun (St0) ->
 1651:                           ?CHECK_BYTE_SIZE(
 1652:                              mwc59_bytes(ByteSize2, St0), ByteSize2, Bin, St1)
 1653:                   end
 1654:           end, {mwc59,bytes}, Iterations div 50,
 1655:           TMarkBytes2, OverheadBytes2),
 1656:     %%
 1657:     ct:log("~nRNG uniform float performance~n",[]),
 1658:     [TMarkUniformFloat,OverheadUniformFloat|_] =
 1659:         measure_1(
 1660:           fun (Mod, _State) ->
 1661:                   Generator = fun Mod:uniform_s/1,
 1662:                   fun (St0) ->
 1663:                             ?CHECK_UNIFORM(Generator(St0), X, St)
 1664:                   end
 1665:           end,
 1666:           Algs, Iterations),
 1667:     _ =
 1668:         measure_1(
 1669:           fun (_Mod, _State) ->
 1670:                   fun (St0) ->
 1671:                           St1 = rand:mwc59(St0),
 1672:                           case rand:mwc59_float(St1) of
 1673:                               R when is_float(R), 0.0 =< R, R < 1.0 ->
 1674:                                   St1
 1675:                           end
 1676:                   end
 1677:           end,
 1678:           {mwc59,float}, Iterations,
 1679:           TMarkUniformFloat, OverheadUniformFloat),
 1680:     _ =
 1681:         measure_1(
 1682:           fun (_Mod, _State) ->
 1683:                   fun (St0) ->
 1684:                           {V,St1} = rand:exsp_next(St0),
 1685:                           case V * (1/(1 bsl 58)) of
 1686:                               R when is_float(R), 0.0 =< R, R < 1.0 ->
 1687:                                   St1
 1688:                           end
 1689:                   end
 1690:           end,
 1691:           {exsp,float}, Iterations,
 1692:           TMarkUniformFloat, OverheadUniformFloat),
 1693:     %%
 1694:     ct:log("~nRNG uniform_real float performance~n",[]),
 1695:     _ =
 1696:         measure_1(
 1697:           fun (Mod, _State) ->
 1698:                   Generator = fun Mod:uniform_real_s/1,
 1699:                   fun (St0) ->
 1700:                           ?CHECK_UNIFORM(Generator(St0), X, St)
 1701:                   end
 1702:           end,
 1703:           Algs, Iterations),
 1704:     %%
 1705:     ct:log("~nRNG normal float performance~n",[]),
 1706:     [TMarkNormalFloat, OverheadNormalFloat|_] =
 1707:         measure_1(
 1708:           fun (Mod, _State) ->
 1709:                   Generator = fun Mod:normal_s/1,
 1710:                   fun (St0) ->
 1711:                           ?CHECK_NORMAL(Generator(St0), X, St1)
 1712:                   end
 1713:           end,
 1714:           Algs, Iterations),
 1715:     %% Just for fun try an implementation of the Box-Muller
 1716:     %% transformation for creating normal distribution floats
 1717:     %% to compare with our Ziggurat implementation.
 1718:     %% Generates two numbers per call that we add so they
 1719:     %% will not be optimized away.  Hence the benchmark time
 1720:     %% is twice what it should be.
 1721:     TwoPi = 2 * math:pi(),
 1722:     _ =
 1723:         measure_1(
 1724:           fun (Mod, _State) ->
 1725:                   fun (St0) ->
 1726:                           {U1, St1} = Mod:uniform_real_s(St0),
 1727:                           {U2, St2} = Mod:uniform_s(St1),
 1728:                           R = math:sqrt(-2.0 * math:log(U1)),
 1729:                           T = TwoPi * U2,
 1730:                           Z0 = R * math:cos(T),
 1731:                           Z1 = R * math:sin(T),
 1732:                           ?CHECK_NORMAL({Z0 + Z1, St2}, X, St3)
 1733:                   end
 1734:           end,
 1735:           exsss, Iterations,
 1736:           TMarkNormalFloat, OverheadNormalFloat),
 1737:     ok.
 1738: 
 1739: measure_loop(State, Fun, I) when 10 =< I ->
 1740:     %% Loop unrolling to dilute benchmark overhead...
 1741:     measure_loop(
 1742:       Fun(Fun(Fun(Fun(Fun(  Fun(Fun(Fun(Fun(Fun(State))))) ))))),
 1743:       Fun, I - 10);
 1744: measure_loop(State, Fun, I) when 1 =< I ->
 1745:     measure_loop(Fun(State), Fun, I - 1);
 1746: measure_loop(_, _, _) ->
 1747:     ok.
 1748: 
 1749: measure_1(InitFun, Algs, Iterations) ->
 1750:     WMark = measure_1(InitFun, hd(Algs), Iterations, warm_up, 0),
 1751:     Overhead =
 1752:         measure_1(
 1753:           fun (_Mod, _State) ->
 1754:                   Range = 1,
 1755:                   fun (St0)
 1756:                       when is_integer(St0), 1 =< St0, St0 =< Range ->
 1757:                           St0
 1758:                   end
 1759:           end, overhead, Iterations, WMark, 0),
 1760:     TMark = measure_1(InitFun, hd(Algs), Iterations, undefined, Overhead),
 1761:     [TMark,Overhead] ++
 1762:         [measure_1(InitFun, Alg, Iterations, TMark, Overhead)
 1763:          || Alg <- tl(Algs)].
 1764: 
 1765: measure_1(InitFun, Alg, Iterations, TMark, Overhead) ->
 1766:     Parent = self(),
 1767:     MeasureFun =
 1768:         fun () ->
 1769:                 {Mod, State} = measure_init(Alg),
 1770:                 IterFun = InitFun(Mod, State),
 1771:                 {T, ok} =
 1772:                     timer:tc(
 1773:                       fun () ->
 1774:                               measure_loop(State, IterFun, Iterations)
 1775:                       end),
 1776:                 Time = T - Overhead,
 1777:                 Percent =
 1778:                     case TMark of
 1779:                         warm_up   -> "(warm-up)";
 1780:                         undefined -> "   100.0%";
 1781:                         _ ->
 1782:                             io_lib:format(
 1783:                               "~8.1f%", [(Time * 100 + 50) / TMark])
 1784:                     end,
 1785:                 io:format(
 1786:                   "~.24w: ~8.1f ns ~s~n",
 1787:                   [Alg, (Time * 1000 + 500) / Iterations, Percent]),
 1788:                 Parent ! {self(), Time},
 1789:                 ok
 1790:         end,
 1791:     Pid = spawn_link(MeasureFun),
 1792:     receive
 1793: 	{Pid, Msg} -> Msg
 1794:     end.
 1795: 
 1796: measure_init(Alg) ->
 1797:     case Alg of
 1798:         overhead ->
 1799:             {?MODULE, 1};
 1800:         crypto64 ->
 1801:             {rand, crypto64_seed()};
 1802:         crypto_cache ->
 1803:             {rand, crypto:rand_seed_alg(crypto_cache)};
 1804:         crypto ->
 1805:             {rand, crypto:rand_seed_s()};
 1806:         crypto_aes ->
 1807:             {rand,
 1808:              crypto:rand_seed_alg(
 1809:                crypto_aes, crypto:strong_rand_bytes(256))};
 1810:         random ->
 1811:             {random, random:seed(os:timestamp()), get(random_seed)};
 1812:         crypto_bytes ->
 1813:             {?MODULE, undefined};
 1814:         crypto_bytes_cached ->
 1815:             {?MODULE, <<>>};
 1816:         unique_phash2 ->
 1817:             {?MODULE, undefined};
 1818:         system_time ->
 1819:             {?MODULE, undefined};
 1820:         procdict ->
 1821:             {rand, rand:seed(exsss)};
 1822:         {Name, Tag} ->
 1823:             case Name of
 1824:                 mwc59 when Tag =:= procdict ->
 1825:                     _ = put(mwc59_procdict, rand:mwc59_seed()),
 1826:                     {rand, undefined};
 1827:                 mwc59 ->
 1828:                     {rand, rand:mwc59_seed()};
 1829:                 exsp ->
 1830:                     {_, S} = rand:seed_s(exsp),
 1831:                     {rand, S};
 1832:                 splitmix64 ->
 1833:                     {rand, erlang:unique_integer()}
 1834:             end;
 1835:         _ ->
 1836:             {rand, rand:seed_s(Alg)}
 1837:     end.
 1838: 
 1839: %% Comparison algorithm for rand:bytes_s/2 vs. crypto:strong_rand_bytes/1
 1840: bytes_s(N, Cache) when is_binary(Cache) ->
 1841:     %% crypto_bytes_cached
 1842:     case Cache of
 1843:         <<Bytes:N/binary, Rest/binary>> ->
 1844:             {Bytes, Rest};
 1845:         <<Part/binary>> ->
 1846:             <<Bytes:N/binary, Rest/binary>> =
 1847:                 <<Part/binary, (crypto:strong_rand_bytes(N * 16))/binary>>,
 1848:             {Bytes, Rest}
 1849:     end;
 1850: bytes_s(N, undefined = St) ->
 1851:     %% crypto_bytes
 1852:     {crypto:strong_rand_bytes(N), St}.
 1853: 
 1854: mwc59_bytes(N, R0) ->
 1855:     mwc59_bytes(N, R0, <<>>).
 1856: %%
 1857: mwc59_bytes(N, R0, Bin) when is_integer(N), 7*4 =< N ->
 1858:     R1 = rand:mwc59(R0),
 1859:     R2 = rand:mwc59(R1),
 1860:     R3 = rand:mwc59(R2),
 1861:     R4 = rand:mwc59(R3),
 1862:     Shift = 59 - 56,
 1863:     V1 = rand:mwc59_value(R1) bsr Shift,
 1864:     V2 = rand:mwc59_value(R2) bsr Shift,
 1865:     V3 = rand:mwc59_value(R3) bsr Shift,
 1866:     V4 = rand:mwc59_value(R4) bsr Shift,
 1867:     mwc59_bytes(N-7*4, R4, <<Bin/binary, V1:56, V2:56, V3:56, V4:56>>);
 1868: mwc59_bytes(N, R0, Bin) when is_integer(N), 7 =< N ->
 1869:     R1 = rand:mwc59(R0),
 1870:     V = rand:mwc59_value(R1) bsr (59-56),
 1871:     mwc59_bytes(N-7, R1, <<Bin/binary, V:56>>);
 1872: mwc59_bytes(N, R0, Bin) when is_integer(N), 0 < N ->
 1873:     R1 = rand:mwc59(R0),
 1874:     Bits = N bsl 3,
 1875:     V = rand:mwc59_value(R1) bsr (59-Bits),
 1876:     {<<Bin/binary, V:Bits>>, R1};
 1877: mwc59_bytes(0, R0, Bin) ->
 1878:     {Bin, R0}.
 1879: 
 1880: 
 1881: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1882: %% The jump sequence tests has two parts
 1883: %% for those with the functional API (jump/1)
 1884: %% and for those with the internal state
 1885: %% in process dictionary (jump/0).
 1886: 
 1887: -define(LOOP_JUMP, (?LOOP div 1000)).
 1888: 
 1889: %% Check if each algorithm generates the proper jump sequence
 1890: %% with the functional API.
 1891: reference_jump_state(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1892:     [reference_jump_1(Alg) || Alg <- algs()],
 1893:     ok.
 1894: 
 1895: reference_jump_1(Alg) ->
 1896:     Refval = reference_jump_val(Alg),
 1897:     if
 1898: 	Refval =:= not_implemented -> Refval;
 1899: 	true ->
 1900: 	    case gen_jump_1(Alg) of
 1901: 		Refval -> ok;
 1902: 		Testval ->
 1903: 		    io:format(
 1904: 		      "Failed: ~p~n",[Alg]),
 1905: 		    io:format(
 1906: 		      "Length ~p ~p~n",
 1907: 		      [length(Refval), length(Testval)]),
 1908: 		    io:format(
 1909: 		      "Head ~p ~p~n",[hd(Refval), hd(Testval)]),
 1910: 		    io:format(
 1911: 		      "Vals ~p ~p~n",[Refval, Testval]),
 1912: 		    exit(wrong_value)
 1913: 	    end
 1914:     end.
 1915: 
 1916: gen_jump_1(Algo) ->
 1917:     case Algo of
 1918: 	exs64 -> %% Test exception of not_implemented notice
 1919: 	    try rand:jump(rand:seed_s(exs64))
 1920: 	    catch
 1921: 		error:not_implemented -> [error_not_implemented]
 1922: 	    end;
 1923: 	_ when Algo =:= exsplus; Algo =:= exsp; Algo =:= exrop; Algo =:= exsss ->
 1924: 	    %% Printed with orig 'C' code and this seed
 1925: 	    gen_jump_2(
 1926: 	      rand:seed_s(Algo, [12345678,12345678]));
 1927: 	_ when Algo =:= exs1024; Algo =:= exs1024s; Algo =:= exro928ss ->
 1928: 	    %% Printed with orig 'C' code and this seed
 1929: 	    gen_jump_2(
 1930: 	      rand:seed_s(Algo, lists:duplicate(16, 12345678)))
 1931:     end.
 1932: 
 1933: gen_jump_2(State) ->
 1934:     Max = range(State),
 1935:     gen_jump_3(?LOOP_JUMP, State, Max, []).
 1936: 
 1937: gen_jump_3(N, State0, Max, Acc) when N > 0 ->
 1938:     {_, State1} = rand:uniform_s(Max, State0),
 1939:     {Random, State2} = rand:uniform_s(Max, rand:jump(State1)),
 1940:     case N rem (?LOOP_JUMP div 100) of
 1941: 	0 -> gen_jump_3(N-1, State2, Max, [Random|Acc]);
 1942: 	_ -> gen_jump_3(N-1, State2, Max, Acc)
 1943:     end;
 1944: gen_jump_3(_, _, _, Acc) -> lists:reverse(Acc).
 1945: 
 1946: 
 1947: %% Check if each algorithm generates the proper jump sequence
 1948: %% with the internal state in the process dictionary.
 1949: reference_jump_procdict(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1950:     [reference_jump_p1(Alg) || Alg <- algs()],
 1951:     ok.
 1952: 
 1953: reference_jump_p1(Alg) ->
 1954:     Refval  = reference_jump_val(Alg),
 1955:     if
 1956: 	Refval =:= not_implemented -> Refval;
 1957: 	true ->
 1958: 	    case gen_jump_p1(Alg) of
 1959: 		Refval -> ok;
 1960: 		Testval ->
 1961: 		    io:format("Failed: ~p~n",[Alg]),
 1962: 		    io:format("Length ~p ~p~n",[length(Refval), length(Testval)]),
 1963: 		    io:format("Head ~p ~p~n",[hd(Refval), hd(Testval)]),
 1964: 		    exit(wrong_value)
 1965: 	    end
 1966:     end.
 1967: 
 1968: gen_jump_p1(Algo) ->
 1969:     case Algo of
 1970: 	exs64 -> %% Test exception of not_implemented notice
 1971: 	    try
 1972: 		_ = rand:seed(exs64),
 1973: 		rand:jump()
 1974: 	    catch
 1975: 		error:not_implemented -> [error_not_implemented]
 1976: 	    end;
 1977: 	_ when Algo =:= exsplus; Algo =:= exsp; Algo =:= exrop; Algo =:= exsss ->
 1978: 	    %% Printed with orig 'C' code and this seed
 1979: 	    gen_jump_p2(
 1980: 	      rand:seed(Algo, [12345678,12345678]));
 1981: 	_ when Algo =:= exs1024; Algo =:= exs1024s; Algo =:= exro928ss ->
 1982: 	    %% Printed with orig 'C' code and this seed
 1983: 	    gen_jump_p2(
 1984: 	      rand:seed(Algo, lists:duplicate(16, 12345678)))
 1985:     end.
 1986: 
 1987: gen_jump_p2(Seed) ->
 1988:     Max = range(Seed),
 1989:     gen_jump_p3(?LOOP_JUMP, Max, []).
 1990: 
 1991: gen_jump_p3(N, Max, Acc) when N > 0 ->
 1992:     _ = rand:uniform(Max),
 1993:     _ = rand:jump(),
 1994:     Random = rand:uniform(Max),
 1995:     case N rem (?LOOP_JUMP div 100) of
 1996: 	0 -> gen_jump_p3(N-1, Max, [Random|Acc]);
 1997: 	_ -> gen_jump_p3(N-1, Max, Acc)
 1998:     end;
 1999: gen_jump_p3(_, _, Acc) -> lists:reverse(Acc).
 2000: 
 2001: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2002: 
 2003: short_jump(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2004:     Seed = erlang:system_time(),
 2005:     short_jump(
 2006:       rand:seed_s(exro928ss, Seed),
 2007:       fun ({Alg,AlgState}) ->
 2008: 	      {Alg,rand:exro928_jump_2pow20(AlgState)}
 2009:       end),
 2010:     case crypto_support() of
 2011:         ok ->
 2012:             short_jump(
 2013:               crypto:rand_seed_alg_s(crypto_aes, integer_to_list(Seed)),
 2014:               fun ({Alg,AlgState}) ->
 2015:                       {Alg,crypto:rand_plugin_aes_jump_2pow20(AlgState)}
 2016:               end),
 2017:             ok;
 2018:         Problem ->
 2019:             {skip,Problem}
 2020:     end.
 2021: 
 2022: short_jump({#{bits := Bits},_} = State_0, Jump2Pow20) ->
 2023:     Range = 1 bsl Bits,
 2024:     State_1 = repeat(7, Range, State_0),
 2025:     %%
 2026:     State_2a = repeat(1 bsl 20, Range, State_1),
 2027:     State_2b = Jump2Pow20(State_1),
 2028:     check(17, Range, State_2a, State_2b),
 2029:     %%
 2030:     {_,State_3a} = rand:uniform_s(Range, State_2a),
 2031:     State_4a = Jump2Pow20(State_3a),
 2032:     State_4b = repeat((1 bsl 20) + 1, Range, State_2b),
 2033:     check(17, Range, State_4a, State_4b).
 2034: 
 2035: repeat(0, _Range, State) ->
 2036:     State;
 2037: repeat(N, Range, State) ->
 2038:     {_, NewState} = rand:uniform_s(Range, State),
 2039:     repeat(N - 1, Range, NewState).
 2040: 
 2041: check(0, _Range, _StateA, _StateB) ->
 2042:     ok;
 2043: check(N, Range, StateA, StateB) ->
 2044:     {V,NewStateA} = rand:uniform_s(Range, StateA),
 2045:     case rand:uniform_s(Range, StateB) of
 2046: 	{V,NewStateB} ->
 2047: 	    check(N - 1, Range, NewStateA, NewStateB);
 2048: 	{Wrong,_} ->
 2049: 	    ct:fail({Wrong,neq,V,for,N})
 2050:     end.
 2051: 
 2052: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2053: %%% Data

 2466: 
 2467: reference_jump_val(_) ->
 2468:     not_implemented.
 2469: 
 2470: 
 2471: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2472: 
 2473: %% The old algorithms used a range 2^N - 1 for their reference val
 2474: %% tests, which was incorrect but works as long as you do not draw
 2475: %% the value 2^N, which is very unlikely.  It was not possible
 2476: %% to simply correct the range to 2^N due to another incorrectness
 2477: %% in that the old algorithms changed to using the broken
 2478: %% (multiply a float approach with too few bits) approach for
 2479: %% ranges >= 2^N.  This function digs out the range to use
 2480: %% for the reference tests for old and new algorithms.
 2481: range({#{bits:=Bits}, _}) -> 1 bsl Bits;
 2482: range({#{max:=Max}, _}) -> Max; %% Old incorrect range
 2483: range({_, _, _}) -> 51. % random
 2484: 
 2485: 
 2486: half_range({#{bits:=Bits}, _}) -> 1 bsl (Bits - 1);
 2487: half_range({#{max:=Max}, _}) -> (Max bsr 1) + 1;
 2488: half_range({#{}, _}) -> 1 bsl 63; % crypto
 2489: half_range({_, _, _}) -> 1 bsl 50. % random
